attack-object.name: Exploit Public-Facing Application
attack-object.comments: This control may provide information about software vulnerabilities in the environment.
attack-object.score-comment: Once this control is deployed, it can detect known vulnerabilities in various Linux OS packages. This information can be used to patch, isolate, or remove vulnerable software and machines. This control does not directly protect against exploitation and is not effective against zero day attacks, vulnerabilities with no available patch, and other end-of-life packages.

attack-object.name: Exploitation for Privilege Escalation
attack-object.comments: This control may provide information about software vulnerabilities in the environment.
attack-object.score-comment: Once this control is deployed, it can detect known OS package vulnerabilities in various Linux OS packages (e.g., Debian, Ubuntu, Alpine, RHEL, CentOS, National Vulnerability Database)

attack-object.name: Exploitation for Client Execution
attack-object.comments: This control may provide information about software vulnerabilities in the environment.
attack-object.score-comment: Once this control is deployed, it can detect known vulnerabilities in various Linux OS packages. This information can be used to patch, isolate, or remove vulnerable software and machines. This control does not directly protect against exploitation and is not effective against zero day attacks, vulnerabilities with no available patch, and other end-of-life packages.

attack-object.name: Exploitation of Remote Services
attack-object.comments: This control may provide information about software vulnerabilities in the environment.
attack-object.score-comment: Once this control is deployed, it can detect known vulnerabilities in various Linux OS packages. This information can be used to patch, isolate, or remove vulnerable software and machines. This control does not directly protect against exploitation and is not effective against zero day attacks, vulnerabilities with no available patch, and other end-of-life packages.

attack-object.name: Implant Internal Image
attack-object.comments: This control may provide information about software vulnerabilities in the environment.
attack-object.score-comment: Once this control is deployed, it can detect known vulnerabilities in Docker containers. This information can be used to detect malicious implanted images in the environment. This control does not directly protect against exploitation.

attack-object.name: Deploy Container
attack-object.comments: This control may provide information about software vulnerabilities in the environment.
attack-object.score-comment: Once this control is deployed, it can detect known vulnerabilities in Docker containers. This information can be used to detect malicious implanted images in the environment. This control does not directly protect against exploitation.

attack-object.name: Software Deployment Tools
attack-object.comments: This control may provide information about software vulnerabilities in the environment.
attack-object.score-comment: Once this control is deployed, it can detect variations to store system packages and container images.

attack-object.name: Exploitation for Defense Evasion
attack-object.comments: This control may provide information about software vulnerabilities in the environment.
attack-object.score-comment: Once this control is deployed, it can detect variations to store system packages and images stored in the repository, which adversaries may target to establish persistence while evading cyber defenses.

attack-object.name: Exploitation for Credential Access
attack-object.comments: This control may provide information about software vulnerabilities in the environment.
attack-object.score-comment: Once this control is deployed, it can detect known OS package vulnerabilities in various Linux OS packages that could be used to escalate privileges and execute adversary-controlled code (e.g., Debian, Ubuntu, Alpine, RHEL, CentOS, National Vulnerability Database)
